page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA.
page.content: Found on the Medway Estuary 39 miles E.of London.The town is sited at 100 feet on the dip slope of the North Downs, facing north. The clay soil is used widely for orchards but a brick works also uses the local clay. The average temps. are 5deg C in January and 18deg C in July, the annual rainfall is about 650mm. The area of Rainham has decreased from 3,562 acres in 1871 to 1,698 in 1961 but the population has increased from 2,082 to 10,101. There has been a rapid growth in population since 1961 and by 1971 it was 15,758. The population is hard to estimate now as, in 1981, Rainham was included in the figure for Gillingham which was 93,741. Rainham is not an industrial town but is the busiest commuter town in the Southern Region.
